annotations: I am a Registered Nurse with over 8 years in the Critical Care (CCU/ICU/SICU), 6 years in the Emergency Room, 2 years Mental Health, 2 years in Apheresis, 6 months Dialysis and 6 months Covid19 Tester.

I have an extensive background in Intensive Care, Emergency medicine, Apheresis, IV placement and infusion therapy. I feel that my professionalism, technical skills, values, beliefs and integrity would be an asset to any
organization.

As a member of Phi Theta Kappa, I am exceptionally reliable, dependable and flexible person whose eagerness to learn is equal to none. If you would like to discuss my qualifications and work experience in more detail, I am available for an interview at any time and at your convenience. I look forward to hearing from you soon.
Sincerely.
Wanda L. Ebron, RN, BSN
Page 2
OBJECTIVE To practice nursing in an environment where I can utilize and develop my professional skills.
GOAL To work as a Registered Nurse while pursuing my MSN degree.
EDUCATION Bachelor of Science in Nursing -- Point Loma Nazarene University May 2000
CERTS EKG, ACLS, BLS, IV, courses in AACN, Polysomnography, ER Nursing I & II, Palliative Care, Mental Health, Dialysis and Apheresis. Familiar with OASIS.
COMPUTER Experience with computer charting to include: EPIC, CERNA, EMAR, Meditech, Medhost, Firstnet, Power Chart and various other programs.

STRENGTHS A high-energy individual with a multi-task orientation. Competent, and capable of making good decisions in the fast-paced environment. A quick study with a facility for adaptation and the ability to form viable working relationships.

04/2021 to current
CVS Covid19 Tester, we enter data into Epic, perform Nasal Swab Testing on the spot (POCT) utilizing the Luminex machine (measures Viral Proteins). And educate patient and families about Covid19, Antigen and PCR Testing as well as Vaccines available at CVS.
10/2020 to 04/2021 DaVita Dialysis

Acute Care RN Duties were to perform dialysis by removing (waste, excess water, and balance electrolytes) for acute patients, many of whom have multiple
co-morbidities (Diabetes, Hypertension, Coronary Artery Disease,) that complicates their treatments. Necessary skills included a high degree of critical thinking with advance skills in monitoring of vital signs, shifting of Intracellular, and Extracellular fluids; excellence in accessing ports (Fistulas, Grafts, Dialysis, and Power-ports).
11/2016 to 07/2019, LifeSouth Blood Centers,

Apheresis RN Performed Plasma Pheresis on patients presenting with Neurologic, Rheumatologic, Autoimmune, and Inflammatory disorders. I operated an Apheresis machine (Optia) to remove diseased antibodies and simultaneously
Page 3
replace them with needed components (Plasma, White & Red Blood Cells, Clotting Factors) to enhance and improve the patient’s prognosis while managing their disease.
01/2016 to 11/2016 Bioscrip Pharmaceuticals

Home Infusion RN Provided in home infusion therapy and training to patients and their families. Duties included accessing ports, initiating infusions, and monitoring vital signs throughout treatments. Placed IV’s, administered injections, IVIG, changed dressings and drew blood. Setup and educated patient and families on Feeding Pumps and other self-infusing devices that administered lifesaving vasoactive drugs.
10/2014 to 12/2016 Social Security Disability
06/2012 to 06/2014 Baptist Medical Center

Critical Care Float RN As a float nurse I worked in all assigned areas (ER, ICU, Telemetry). I provided direct bedside care to include administration and titration of vasoactive drugs; assisted with Intubation/Extubation and cared for ventilated patients. Comfortable with NG/OG/Peg. Assisted with Invasive Lines, and Chest Tube placement. Performed ADL’s (activities of daily living) and provided patient/family education. Other duties according to area assigned.
02/2012 to 05/2012, AYA Agency

ER Travel RN As an emergency room nurse, I assessed all emergencies based on a 5-tier triage system. Provided immediate care to emergent patients and sought care based on severity of symptoms. Re-evaluated patients waiting to be seen.
Placed IVs and drew blood. Provided care for minor and major injuries (lacerations/fractures, and broken bones), with immediate attention to (Heart attacks, Strokes, Diabetic crisis, Drug Overdose, active Bleeding, AMS and Psych). Also cared for patients of all ages. Assisted with Code Blues and provided patient and family education.
Page 4
10/2008 to 09/2009 Naval Air Station Jacksonville

Emergency Room Nurse Triaged patients according to a 5-tier system, placed intravenous lines, administered medications and assisted with the care of patients of all ages. Assisted with Conscious Sedation and Code Blues as needed.
04/2006 to 09/2008 Behavioral Health Center

Fact Nurse Assisted clients in their homes with ADL’s, Medical/Dental appointments. Assisted clients with making competent decisions to improve their ability to live outside of an Institution. Administered daily medications.
09/2004 to 11/2010 USAR NURSE CORPS

Army Nurse Successfully completed Basic Training for Officers. I had administrative duties overseeing subordinate soldiers in my unit. Assisted in training soldiers in Basic Life Support (BLS). In charge of the commands Illegal Drug Testing. Various other duties as assigned.
REFERENCES Available upon request
